attributes.review: Story time: I downloaded this app because i’m a white supremacist, and as soon as I opened it, I was immediately startled by this gigantic orange 🍊 that popped up on my screen. It was old and wrinkly, and the sight was so horrific that I had to throw my phone across the room to refrain from throwing up. Anyway, I wanted to get this app to receive some completely non-biased news about the election, and I have to admit that the quality of this app was horrible. It was very slow, and it forced me to enter all of my personal information. Once I did, I started receiving so much spam through text, email, and phone calls. As soon as I unsubscribed, I started getting death threats through the mail saying that if I don’t subscribe again, I’ll become yet another victim of police brutality that will not receive justice. Lucky, I knew that my white privilege would protect me from that. I strongly recommend this app for my fellow white supremacists that wish to continue to deny systematic racism. It’s completely your fault if a cop murders you. Continuing with my review, this app forced me to join a cult. They kept on sending me reminders to comment “🇺🇸Trump 2020🇺🇸” on every single comment section of every post that I see. The reminders were very annoying, so I eventually turned them off. But I did follow through with their requests. In fact, I even added something a little extra to the chant. It went a little something like “💅✨🧚‍♂️Trump 2020✨🧚‍♂️🍊 But make it an expiration date✨🧚‍♂️💖.” It’s a beautiful quote and everyone seemed to enjoy my comments. Thank you for listening to my ted talk.
attributes.title: This app made me break my phone
